title: What should beginner ARMYs know about BTS and their songs? - Quora

response.answer_text: welcome to the fandom! :) here are some things to know about their songs. they have lots of different genres.don’t be discouraged if you don’t like some of the songs you hear. they have ALL KINDS of songs, from hip hop to edm to pop to rap to ballads, they’re are a lot of styles to choose from.don’t just listen to title tracks.title tracks are like the “lead songs” of the album(s). for example, DNA, ON, and IDOL are some of their popular title tracks. imo, some of bts’ best songs are their b-sides. b-sides are like the “side songs” that are not promoted as the head of the albums. 134340 and answer: love myself are two of my favorite songs of all time, and they are both b-sides.check out their solo songs.in every (not mini) album starting from their album “wings,” each member has a solo song where it’s just them singing. some of the solos are written/composed by them too. they’re all really good. personally i prefer jin and namjoon’s solo songs, but you should check them out for sure. the solo songs kinda reflect on each of the members’ personal music tastes.don’t ignore their early songs.their early style was a very emo-hip hop vibe. you might think you don’t like those kinds of songs, i did too, but after listening to “danger,” i was sold. their older songs are really, really fun to listen to, you should check them out.learn to tell each of their voices apart. here’s a quick guide:namjoon (rap)normally has the english rap parts.raps really fast.has a kind of boston-ish accent when speaking english.has a distinct voice.suga (rap)fastest rapper most of the time.sounds similar to j-hope but less energetic.almost like mumble rap.j-hope (rap, very occasionally does vocals)generally the slower rapper (not a bad thing).really energetic voice.kinda nasally voice.jin (vocal)very breathy (not in a bad way).really powerful, almost tight sounding high notes.has a silvery voice (idk what that even means but that’s just how i feel lmao).sounds a little like jungkook, but you can tell them apart by the way they end phrases.jimin (vocal)really sweet, sugary voice.generally the highest pitched vocal.his voice is sort of feminine (not a bad thing).has a really distinct voice.v (vocal)deepest voice.really rich, creamy voice.has a large range, but is almost always the lowest pitched vocal.really distinct voice.jungkook (vocal, raps in some of bts’ really early songs)breathy in his solo songs but very clear in group songs.he is also on the high pitched side.can hit every single high note ever.almost always has the most lines, or at least the most vocals.watch their music videos!a lot of their mv’s are really deep, and make the songs even more enjoyable. here are some of their best music videos imo:blood sweat and tears (really deep and almost confusing, but super cool.)spring day (kinda depressing, but really meaningful. i’d search up the meaning behind this one, because it’s really powerful.)run (part of their BU storyline. a little graphic because there’s a little bit of blood (i think there is.. i might be getting it mixed up with the highlight reel), but it’s very good.)fake love (not a huge fan of the song itself, but the mv is very beautifully shot.)look into their song lyrics.bts is known for writing a lot of their own songs, and also for their lyrics. their lyrics are really powerful (well most of them are anyways). here are some of their songs with the most powerful lyrics imo:epiphany (solo song by jin)spring dayno more dream (their debut/first official song)jamais vu (jungkook, jin, j-hope)answer: love myselfhope this helps!! :)

First of all, a lot of guides out there will give you basic info on the members, but here’s something the guides may not tell you: RM is the “god of destruction,” and while he does break a lot of things, he’s the glue that keeps BTS together. While his IQ is 148, he’s a person that can make mistakes, he’s human just like the rest of us :). His rap voice is powerful, and his lyrics are so skillfully written. Talent.Suga isn’t just intimidating and “savage”. While he can be that way (and it can be really funny), he’s also caring, warm, and soft sometimes. While he can be introverted and quiet, when the time is right he’ll come out of his shell and just be a bursting ball of energy.J-hope, our sunshine. Yes he’s our hope, our angel, and he’s smiling more times than he’s not. On screen. But remember that he is human too, he doesn’t have to smile all the time. He’s stuck with the burden of being the “happy one” even when he’s not happy, and I hope he knows that it’s ok not to be happy all the time. Anyway, he has a unique rap voice, and is a dance king.Jin, the oldest, is hilarious, I personally think his personality is under appreciated. His voice is beautiful and I’m glad he’s getting more lines than he used to have. He’s improving so much, I’m so proud of him. His laugh is contagious, his food is delicious (I know without even trying it), and he’s worldwide handsome (and he lets everybody know).V. I’ve noticed he’s become more quite lately and that’s ok. It doesn’t mean something is wrong, it just means that he’s matured. A lot of people say that they miss his quirkiness, but honestly who says it’s gone? He doesn’t have to act a certain way. Anyway, his soulful voice makes you want to close your eyes and listen. He’s the king of Gucci and has a cute dog named Yeontan.Jimin, our mochi. Mochi is a Japanese sticky rice cake and it’s his nickname. Jimin is like…the one that can recharge everyone with a hug. His laugh can cure your sadness. I don’t know what else to say about him besides the fact that he’s just amazing. (Even though it sounds like it, I promise he’s not my bias lol). His voice is unique, and his style of dancing is sooooo good.Jungkook our baby maknae(youngest). He joined BTS at a young age and has been taken care of by the other members since then. He fights with Jin a lot (playfully), and joined because he saw RM rapping and was amazed by him. He's multitalented and is good at everything. His voice is beautiful, he can rap like nobody’s business, and he’s a great dancer.If you really want to get to know them, I would watch their reality show “Run BTS” even though there’s over 100 episodes and counting, so it’s a lot to catch up on. Even I’m like 20 episodes behind because after episode 92 I stopped watching them every week. There are also a lot of content on YouTube, and they do livestreams sometimes on an app called V Live. Music: BTS’ music has a variety of genres. Honestly, I suggest just listening to everything lmao. would start with either their recent album or Love Yourself: Answer, and then start from the beginning. I don’t suggest starting from the beginning because it’s…just different I don’t really know how else to explain it.Their music style has changed over the years(not saying that this is a bad or good thing), and you can tell just by listening to the title tracks from each era.There are some solo tracks, meaning that a member has their own song, and each rapper has their own mixtape(s).My favorite songs: Pied Piper (a really catchy song, I feel like almost anyone would like it)Just One DayHouse of CardsDon’t Leave MeFake Love (my favorite title track)TearBest of MeSeesawMy TimeUGH!Hope that helps, sorry for the long post :). Welcome to the fandom! ~Bye

Alright, let’s get into it! The Group: BTS is a seven-member Korean idol group under BigHit entertainment. They started out as a Hip-Hop group, and branches out into other genres, such as R&B, EDM, and Pop. They’re the highest-selling Korean act, with multiple albums surpassing 1,000,000 sales. Their latest album, Map of the Soul: 7 alone has over 5,000,000 sales. They’ve sold out stadiums internationally such as MetLife in New Jersey, Rose Bowl in California, and Wembley in London. They debuted in 2013, when BigHit was a nearly broke company. BigHit was in this financial state due to multiple members of a past group, the girl group GLAM, getting in legal trouble such as blackmail. BTS remained the only group under the label until 2019 with the debut of Tomorrow X Together. The music: BTS’ music spans nearly every genre, and is nearly all self-produced and written by members. Here is a genre breakdown: Hip-Hop: They have a vast expanse of songs in this genre, some typical, some atypical. Here’s a few examples:We are Bulletproof pt. 2No More DreamCypher pt. 1, 2, 3, and 4UGH!00:00 (melodic, ballad hybrid?)Fake LoveOutro: HerOutro: TearAll Night (ft. Juice WRLD)Silver SpoonEDM is another genre they cover. Here’s a list of some of those songs:Dead LeavesDNABlood Sweat and TearsSave MeR&B is also frequently found in their discography.LikeSingularityStigmaBeginMy TimeHOME134340Pied PiperPop is less frequent, but still there.Boy With Luv (ft. Halsey)Dream Glow (ft. Charli XCX)MoonGrunge-esque, punkish Rock? They have that too!War of HormoneDangerDionysusMa CityA more alternative vibe?RunI Need UConverse HighParadiseBallads? Yup. Got that.The Truth UntoldSpring DayAwakeThe members: Kim Namjoon (RM): Rapper, LeaderHe started underground with the stage name “Runch Randa”1st to join BigHit, the group was actually built off of him being in the company.2 mixtapes (RM and Mono.)Born in September 1994, from Ilsan, SKFluent in EnglishReally wholesome guy, likes trees and nature, bikes instead of drives.He actually spoke at the UN headquarters in 2018. Avid supporter of LGBTQ+ rights, gender equality, racial equality, et cetera.He writes lyrics and produces a lot of the (BTS and his solo) music.Has collabs with artists such as Younha, Tiger JK, NELL, HONNE, Fallout Boy, Zico (predebut), Agust D (see below), Lil Nas X (performed at the Grammy’s for this one), and WaleFriends with Got7 JacksonSolo songs on BTS albums: Reflection, What Am I To You, Intro: Persona, Trivia: LoveBT21 = Koya Kim Seokjin (Jin): Singer, VisualBorn December 4th 1992Scouted at college, double majored in Film and AnimationHe used to have pet sugar gliders and dogs, but they have all passed away. His song (on the BTS SoundCloud) “이밤” (or “Tonight”) is about them.He can cook!He loves to crack dad jokes.His face is literally scientifically perfect, and his voice is acclaimed by prestigious organizations like the Recording Acadamy.Solo Songs on BTS albums: Awake, Epiphany, MoonBT21 = RJ Min Yoongi (SUGA, Agust D): RapperBorn March 9th 1993Second to join BH, was originally signed as a producer, but alike Namjoon, was also in the underground rap scene.2 Mixtapes under the name “Agust D”- Agust D (2016) and D-2 (2020).Collabs and production credits with artists such as Halsey, IU, HEIZE, Lee So Ra, MAX, and Suran.From Daegu- Agust D backwards is DT SUGA- aka Daegu Town SUGA.He played basketball, and was a shooting guard. That’s where he got “SUGA” from- (Shoo)ting (Gua)rd! 수가!People say he’s cold, rude, and standoffish, but that’s absolutely not the case. He’s actually really sweet, in a similar way to Namjoon.Going off of this, he’s also really supportive of the lgbtq+ community. He’s even mentioned possibly being a part of it. No, those weren’t mistranslations. 15/10, he’d bodyslam a homophobe. God I love him.going off of THIS, “Cypher pt. 3” around 3:45 seconds. see those lyrics for yourself.He’s an incredible lyricist and producer, has credits on the majority of BTS songs, alike Namjoon.Grew up relatively poor, and struggled with anxiety, depression, and suicidal thoughts. See the Agust D mixtape lyrics for more on this, especially “The Last” and “724148”Solo Songs on BTS albums: Intro: The Most Beautiful Moment in Life, First Love, Interlude: Shadow, Trivia: Seesawnot to be dramatic but he deserves the world.BT21 = Shooky Jung Hoseok (j-hope): Rapper, DancerBorn February 18th, 1994From GwanjuWas an underground dancer, in a team called Neuron.He was actually somewhat famous for this, and was on a JYP competition program with his team. BTS predebut was also known as “the group with Jung Hoseok”.1 mixtape - Hope World (2018)Collabs with Jo Kwon and Becky G.“Sunshine” personality! He’s super upbeat and bubbly from what we see. A human battery!He can also produce, and does so for a number of songs, but not as often as Joon and Yoongi.Solo Songs on BTS albums: MAMA, Intro: Boy Meets Evil, Trivia: Just Dance, Outro: EgoBT21 = Mang Park Jimin: Singer, DancerBorn October 13th, 1995From BusanDid Ballet predebut for years.oh my god I would take a bullet for him you do not understand.A soft but bubbly personality. He giggles a lot. It absolutely wrecks me. He’s just so precious.F*ck Gender Norms king.often wears Chelsea boots.Has a cultural award for his fan dance segment of the 2018 “Idol” MAMA performance.On the song “Who” by Lauv.solo songs on BTS albums: Lie, Intro: Serendipity, FilterBT21 = Chimmy Kim Taehyung (V): Singer, VisualBorn December 30th, 1995From DaeguAuditioned on… saxophone of all things. He got in, though, and that’s what matters!Loves art and fashion design.Baritone vocals, with a huge range!Praised for his visuals and modeling skills (from photo shoots for brand sponsorships and album shoots)He’s an actor! He had a major role in Hwarang and is on it’s OST (on a song with Seokjin!)Part of the Wooga squad- basically think if Harry Styles was BFFs with Brad Pitt and Chris Evans.It’s basically an elite friend group. Tae’s the youngest, but it includes big Korean actors and a lesser known musician or two. The ones I remember off the top of my head as I write this are Park Seojoon (Itaewon Class, minor role in Parasite), Choi Wooshik (Parasite), and Peakboy (musician).Solo Songs on BTS albums: Stigma, Intro: Singularity, Inner ChildBT21 = Tata Jeon Jungkook: Singer, Dancer, Center, MaknaeBorn September 1st, 1997From BusanScouted by several major companies at a young age, including JYP. He chose BigHit because he was a Namjoon fanboy.His first words upon meeting Namjoon were: “Wow. Thighs”.He’s actually also a sub-rapper, meaning he can rap well if need be. This was mainly utilized around debut to Dark & Wild eras.Part of the famous ‘97 line group chat- an amalgamation of idols born in ‘97.Other members include Got7 BamBam and Yugyeom, Seventeen’s Mingyu, Astro’s Cha Eunwoo, and NCT’s Jaehyun. Quite a squad of I do say so myself.Also on “Who” by LauvSolo Songs on BTS albums: Begin, Euphoria (also on the HBO show’s soundtrack!), and My Time.BT21 = Cooky
response.upvotes: Answer requested by Leigh R Thrompt

response.answer_text: Beginner ARMYs their songs are wonderful and have amazing meanings behind it. If your an International ARMY just know that you may not understand but there’s a connection there. Their songs are amazing and so are they. So make sure to get to know them and learn about them before judging them like many others and know that they hold great importance to many other ARMYs heart. Don’t stress about becoming the perfect ARMY and an ARMY just appreciate all of the members and love all of them and you are already counted an ARMY. Be there for them and help support them. Your an new ARMY please go to the VMAs page. Make an account and vote for BTS on Best Pop and Best Kpop please thank you! Oh an go onto Facebook and message the VMAs asking them if you can vote! Thanks! Be ready for DYNAMITE!
response.upvotes: Answer requested by Leigh R Thrompt

response.answer_text: Beginner army shouldn't rely on YouTube video. They show many misconceptions like Jin is eomma, Suga is arrogant and lazy etc. In my opinion new Army should watch more compilation and predict their personalities by themselves like I did and make their own opinion. Newer army should know that ships (for example- Namjin, Sope, Taekook, Jinkook) are for fun. And I will suggest stay away from ship videos for a while. I've saw some tweets that many of them used to hate Jimin as it (ship videos) shows him bad. BTS have shows like Run BTS, Bon Voyage Some documentries/ films- Burn the stage, Break the silence , Bring the soul Army can choose genre they want to listen then slowly and steadily discover whole discography I personally love MIKROKOSMOS, Magic shop, Love Maze, Spring day, Answer: love myself, So what alot They also release Japanese albums like recent one MOTS7: the journey. Their Bangtan Universe (BU) which is fictional world created by them.

The main thing to know about their songs is that they are definitely very experimental with their sound. They don’t stick around with one genre for a long time. Some people love it, some people hate it but that’s who they are. They like incorporating new sounds that they haven’t previously tried before. Personally I like this since it keeps us fans interested in what they will try next and makes things interesting, different from artists who are very true to only one genre or sound, their music evolves quickly. I love it because it keeps things exciting for us ARMYS.

Let’s start by going over some basic rules of the ARMY fandom: No starting fanwars with other groupsLove and respect all members of BTS and all members of the fandom equally (having a bias is okay, just don’t become a solo stan)Love yourselfDon’t call BTS perfect. They’re humans - they have flaws, just like the rest of usAnd now some facts about songs: certain songs are far more sexual than they first let on (prime examples: Blanket Kick (also called Embarrassed); War of Hormone; Blood, Sweat and Tears; Miss Right)there are underrated songs that are so, so deserving of more love and recognition than they currently have (i.e. Beautiful, 95 Graduation, and Adult Child)members’ solo tracks are still BTS tracks, so treat them that wayAnd I have one last message, just before I finish my answer: Whatever you do, do not become Oli London. If you don’t know who that is, just type his name into Google and you’ll see why ARMYs have such a problem with him.

Welcome new ARMY!! Well first, an army should know their stage names and real names and some of their nicknames. You should also know about weverse and vlive. They have an Instagram and twitter and the members have their own personal accounts run by big hit. about their music, they have some deep lyrics and songs but they also have some very fun and light lyrics and songs. they sing about things they have gone through and have amazing concepts. glad you could join the fandom! hope you enjoy the group and the music!!
